lines.text: Tell me, Eddie. Has he been drinking?
Well... uh...
A lot?
Well, it wouldn't be a lot for a camel or one of them things.
A lot of people don't believe that gag about being born equal.
Well, it's about your daughter.
Jan? Well, what about her?
Why, I want to marry her.
What? What was that?
What's the matter with that?

What's the matter with it? The only time I hate democracy is when one of you mongrels forget where you belong... a few illegal dollars and a clean shirt and you move across the railroad tracks. Tell your boy to bring me some libations, and don't insult your guests!
Mr. Ashe, a guy like me has to ride with lady luck. A squealer leaves his pals in plenty of trouble.
Hmm, I see. You want to go to the gallows with your mouth shut.
You saw Miss Ashe in court, boys. Slouch, tell her why the Hardy mob tried to fix me up. Tell her the facts, Slouch.

Well, the mug that was rubbed out, Miss, was a snooper of the chief's running with the Hardy mob, slipping us the lowdown. Hardy gets hep to it and he puts the rat on the spot. They nab the boss's "kelly" and plants it. Your old man jaws him out and the Hardy mob grabs the typewriters and the ukeleles.

[to Jan]
I've had to drink as I've had to breathe, and you know it!
I wish my mother belonged to some other family.
Frightened?
No, I love it.
You love what?
Oh, I don't know. You're just a new kind of man in a new kind of world.

[to Dwight]
I just don't want to get married, Dwight. I don't want life to settle down around me like a pan of sour dough. I don't want it one little bit.

[to Jan]
It's leopard sweat! You can't trust it!
That's all that marriage is, just two people that want to live together. You can call the rest, just nothin'! You're a thrill! You're mine and I want ya!

[Sarcastically]
Just the kind of a marriage I've always dreamed about.
The key to my success is to never say die.
What's the tricks? What's the tricks?
Why, if I told you how often I wished I'd have you like this, you wouldn't believe it.
Why me? The world's full of girls.
Well, why'd Romeo take on so much grief?
Do you think you could like me?
I don't quite know what's happened? Whether its just the end of a perfect day - or - whether I'm just a little mad.
Don't run away from things. Don't hide. Get out in the middle of life and if the wind blows you over - pick yourself up again. Make your own mistakes and learn by them.
Here, give this problem a little thought, Mr. Einstein.
Well, well, Mr. Ashe, we've been waiting for you. This is quite an honor.
Honor, my hat!

[Seductively]
Hello, there.
Hello, yourself. Say, it's great to come up and find you here like this.
Is it now? Well, what are you going to do about it?
I was just wondering what I'd do if you stopped dropping in?
Very interesting. You just talked yourself out of the warmest osculation.
Say, don't women ever want to talk?
Is it, eh, physiology or biology?
What do you mean?
Ha-ha. Men of action are better in action, they don't talk well.
You do love me, don't you?
It's just madness, nothing else.
How much do you love me?
How much? Let me see how much... well, it's about ten feet high and about seven feet wide.
No, no, never mind that.
Oh, I can't measure it now, its a storm at sea.
What's on your mind, darling?
I want to marry you.
Why?
Why? What do you think, why? I'm off my nut about you.
Marrying you is serious, darn serious. It would mean the end of a lot of things for me. My world would close up on me in a minute.
Oh, why worry about 'em! A lot of high hat chislers!
Come on, put 'em around me.
No, I'm not cheap. Not even you can say I am. I can't let you.
He no like 'em nobody like 'em like you.
You think you're quite a gal, don't you?
Oh, it doesn't matter what I think.
You can cut out the kiddin', Jan. You used to get away with that half-kiddin' stuff. I figured it was your language over my head.
Said he, and suddenly the moonbeams turn to worms - and crawl away.
I didn't know until last night what I was really doing to myself. What a beast you were when the surface is scratched. I found out that only swines should travel with swines.
Say, you're talkin' to the man you love!

It makes me sick to even hear you say the word. I've lost the right ever again to think of what love can be or what it means. Marry you? For, the rest of my life can't wash the filthy mark of you out of my soul!
You can't get away from me. I never was as nuts about you as I am right now. You can be walking along the street or out in your car; but, I'll get ya. All I'm gonna do now is kiss ya.
Now, let me lay it on the line for you. She tossed all the ritz overboard months ago. She came to my place and she stayed there, you get that? She's mine. She belongs to me.
Listen, buddy. Take a tip. Back out! Right now.
Sit down, this is a good place to talk.
You're not going to talk, any more.
Jan, darling, don't cry. There's so little to say, isn't there. Except, I love you.
You ought to hate me. I wish you did. I'm not worth what you've done.
Oh, I love you. I love you as much as I despise myself.
Don't you see, my hands are bleeding where the spikes have been driven threw.
Did he threaten to kidnap you?
Yes, he did.
Was he truthful when he said you went to his place and stayed there?
Yes.
Did he kidnap you the first time you went there and stayed?
No.
You went because you wanted to, didn't you?
Yes.
Over how long a period did you go to his place and stay because you wanted to?
Several months.
You've been to school, haven't you Miss Ashe?
Yes.
Good American schools?
Yes.
And you were over 21 when you went to Wilfong and belonged to him, weren't you?
Yes, sir.
And he only became a beast, after you were through with the experience and he wasn't. Isn't that it?
You're honor, I object to this form of bullying.
I'm through.
Wait a little while, darling. I'll be in New York, working at something.
